data.title: Lara Gamble named Fellow of AVS
data.meta_description: Lara Gamble has been named as Fellow of AVS (American Vacuum Society), recognizing her contributions to novel biomedical surface analysis tools, methodology
data.meta_site_name: UW Bioengineering | University of Washington Department of Bioengineering
data.text:
UW Bioengineering Research Associate Professor Lara Gamble has been named as Fellow of AVS (American Vacuum Society).

This fellowship recognizes AVS members who have made sustained and outstanding scientific and technical contributions in areas of interest to AVS. This award is the premier membership recognition for this professional society.

Dr. Gamble is recognized for her continued development of novel biomedical surface analysis tools and methodology for advancing our understanding of diagnostic devices and biological materials. Learn more about Dr. Lara Gamble.

Dr. Gamble will be publicly honored at an awards ceremony at the 62nd AVS International Symposium and Exhibition this October in San Jose, Calif.

AVS is an international community of scientists, engineers and instrument manufacturers which strives to promote research and communicate knowledge in the important areas of surface, interface, vacuum and thin film science/technology for the advancement of humankind.
